Data Structures

Here are the data structures with brief descriptions:
SDL_ActiveEventApplication visibility event structure
SDL_AudioCVTA structure to hold a set of audio conversion filters and buffers
SDL_AudioSpecWhen filling in the desired audio spec structure,
  • 'desired->freq' should be the desired audio frequency in samples-per-second
SDL_CDThis structure is only current as of the last call to SDL_CDStatus()
SDL_CDtrack
SDL_Color
SDL_Cursor
SDL_EventGeneral event structure
SDL_ExposeEventThe "screen redraw" event
SDL_JoyAxisEventJoystick axis motion event structure
SDL_JoyBallEventJoystick trackball motion event structure
SDL_JoyButtonEventJoystick button event structure
SDL_JoyHatEventJoystick hat position change event structure
SDL_KeyboardEventKeyboard event structure
SDL_keysymKeysym structure
SDL_MouseButtonEventMouse button event structure
SDL_MouseMotionEventMouse motion event structure
SDL_OverlayThe YUV hardware video overlay
SDL_Palette
SDL_PixelFormatEverything in the pixel format structure is read-only
SDL_QuitEventThe "quit requested" event
SDL_Rect
SDL_ResizeEventThe "window resized" event When you get this event, you are responsible for setting a new video mode with the new width and height
SDL_RWopsThis is the read/write operation structure -- very basic
SDL_SurfaceThis structure should be treated as read-only, except for 'pixels', which, if not NULL, contains the raw pixel data for the surface
SDL_SysWMEvent
SDL_SysWMinfoThe generic custom window manager information structure
SDL_SysWMmsgThe generic custom event structure
SDL_UserEventA user-defined event type
SDL_version
SDL_VideoInfoUseful for determining the video hardware capabilities
Uint64
